title: feat(#1356): create server api v1

labels.name: status: wontfix
labels.description: Indicates that work won't continue on an issue or pull request

body:
This will be the main PR and focus on 2 lines of work:

- Preparing current components to be used from new API handlers
- Adapt documentation to include the rest API reference.


The rest of the work will be incremental and will be split into several PR against this one, so we can control locally the different changes.

There is a draft version of the documentation that can be explored [here](https://rubrix.readthedocs.io/en/feat-server-api-v1/reference/api/index.html)

See recognai/rubrix-roadmap#76

title: TokenClassification and TextClassification on the same interface

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

labels.name: type: community request
labels.description: Indicates a feature requested by someone outside of the Argilla organization

labels.name: type: popular request
labels.description: Indicates that several people outside of the Argilla organization are interested in this feature

body:
I need to annotate data where for each document I need to annotate named-entities (i.e., token level classification) and also a set of labels (doc-level classification)

How can one achieve this with rubrix, as far as I understood you need to have two different collections, for the two different tasks, and then, after annotating and exporting them, you need to merge the annotations.

Is there any way to have this done inside rubrix - also on the interface?

title: Some tokens/text associated with a prediction not showing up/hidden in TokenClassification Record

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

body: I am uploading TokenClassificationRecords and sometimes some of the text/tokens that correspond to a prediction are hidden. As you can see in the images the text should read "anxiety and dysphoria in the setting of", and when I inspect the html the word "dysphoria" appears in the html. However it appears to be hidden in the text. If I do command-f on the page to search for the word "dysphoria" it then shows up, overlapping with the words that are meant to come after it. The third image I have provided demonstrates this. The word "dysphoria" was included as a prediction. If I do not include it as a prediction, then this issue does not occur.

title: [Token Classification metrics] Review entity consistency and mentions histograms

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

body:
The first version of `entity_consistency` adds a threshold param and forces it to be greater than 2 (see https://github.com/recognai/rubrix/blob/7e806ad8b9d3b2abf54b14c87c335022c60633ff/src/rubrix/metrics/token_classification/metrics.py#L378). I'd like to get rid of this logic as I think counterintuitive.

Related to this, we briefly discussed this but having a list of the top N mentions (and their types) in the metrics module would be really useful. I say this because this would be solved by threshold=1 but maybe the name `entity_consistency` is not the best naming. One might argue that is not the best in any case, but I could live with both options:

1. Changing the name `entity_consistency` to something more meaningful and keeping the threshold parameter (without enforcing >=2, but still have the default=2)
2.  Have a separate metric top_k_mentions for the mentions and keep entity_consistency as is (although I still think forcing >=2 is not the best option).
3. Keep the name `entity_consistency` and keep the threshold parameter (without enforcing >=2, but ). This is probably the fastest way to do this (without enforcing >=2, but still have the default=2)

What do you think @frascuchon @dcfidalgo ?

title: fix(#1375): Pin click version for the Black pre-commit hook
body:
Closes #1375 .  

Pins the click version to `8.0.4` for the Black pre-commit hook.    

This PR fixes the bug without having to change or upgrade any of the pre-commit hooks.

title: Black pre-commit hook triggers ImportError for the click dependency

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

labels.name: area: ci
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the Continuous Integration (CI)

body:
**Describe the bug**

The version of Black used in the pre-commit hooks ( `21.9b0` ) automatically utilizes the latest `click` version ( `8.1.0` ) which is incompatible. Simply running Black through a pre-commit hook will trigger an ImportError.

See also: [(psf/black) Incompatible with click 8.1.0 (ImportError: cannot import name '_unicodefun' from 'click') #2964](https://github.com/psf/black/issues/2964) 

**To Reproduce**

Install pre-commit hooks as described on the [Developer documentation](https://rubrix.readthedocs.io/en/stable/community/developer_docs.html), make changes to a branch, and then try to make a commit.

title: TokenClassification scoring filtering doe not work within UI

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

body:
**Describe the bug**
When filtering on prediction score within TokenClassification, I do not get TokenClassificaiton scores within the filter.

**To Reproduce**
run [this code](https://github.com/Pandora-Intelligence/rubrix-blogs/blob/main/concise-concepts.ipynb). 

**Expected behavior**
I would expect that all classified token and sentences are filtered based on their scoring. Resulting in only showing sentences that contain one or more entities within the filter, without showing entities outside the filter.

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25269220/161485221-d115c46b-b745-4b5e-8970-f53b83eb80d6.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25269220/161485257-43ce9fa5-baa5-46d9-9e98-0d7e6c520c38.png)


**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS [e.g. iOS]:
 - Browser [e.g. chrome, safari]: Firefox
 - Rubrix Version [e.g. 0.10.0]: 0.13.0
 - ElasticSearch Version [e.g. 7.10.2]: 7.11.1


**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

title: Odd behavior for some labels in TokenClassificationRecord

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

body:
**Describe the bug**

For a TokenClassificationRecord, some of the predictions don't show up correctly. As shown in the image below, the word 'Snoring' isn't underlined like the word 'Fatigue' is. And when I hover over 'Snoring' the expected pop up is displayed without color. For context, we have many labels (~100).

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Upload many TokenClassifcationRecords with many labels and predictions.


**Expected behavior**

All tokens that correspond to predictions are displayed in the same manner. Underlined with a color, etc...

**Screenshots**

![Screen Shot 2022-03-31 at 2 22 00 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15001058/161124136-4f8da4a2-4e1c-403d-9e9e-737f3420f745.png)


**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS [e.g. iOS]: Linux / Mac
 - Browser [e.g. chrome, safari]: Chrome
 - Rubrix Version [e.g. 0.10.0]: 0.13.0
 - ElasticSearch Version [e.g. 7.10.2]:
 - Docker Image (optional) [e.g. rubrix:v0.10.0]:

title: Can't view metadata when text is too large for TokenClassificationRecord

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

body:
**Describe the bug**

For a TokenClassificationRecord, when I upload metadata with the record, and then click the three vertical dots to view the metadata associated with that record, the text is also shown with the metadata. When there isn't much text this is not an issue. But when the text is large, one cannot see the metadata. I included 2 images below demonstrating both scenarios. In the second image  the metadata is not visible.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Upload a TokenClassification Record with large amounts of text and metadata
2. Click the three vertical dots to try and view the metadata

**Expected behavior**

Would it be possible to not include the text when viewing the metadata, as the text itself is not metadata? Or possibly just be able to scroll down within the metadata pop up so one can see the metadata.

**Screenshots**
![Screen Shot 2022-03-31 at 2 07 41 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15001058/161122290-76c5ca90-9c1d-4f72-805d-f7c3c0cb2896.png)

![Screen Shot 2022-03-31 at 2 07 57 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15001058/161122311-85de7cf5-d690-4b4f-9f92-521ad3994488.png)


**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS [e.g. iOS]: Linux/Mac
 - Browser [e.g. chrome, safari]: Chrome
 - Rubrix Version [e.g. 0.10.0]: 0.13.0
 - ElasticSearch Version [e.g. 7.10.2]:
 - Docker Image (optional) [e.g. rubrix:v0.10.0]:

title: Using regex for defining a rule fails

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

body:
When trying to define a rule using regex format the _save rule_ button does not work and the rule is not saved.

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to any dataset already uploaded to Rubrix
2. Click on _Define rules_ and press enter to see the results filtered
3. Then click on the corresponding label
4. The last step, clicking on  _save rule_ button, does not work so therefore it does not save the rule in the _Manage rules_ dashboard.

The following description is an example of a query and the error it throws.  
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/102751804/161099925-b2aa796f-f30d-4753-8e48-95b63ec29d3a.png)

I'm using the last version of Rubrix **(v.0.13.0)**.

milestone.title: v0.15.0
milestone.description: This Milestone manages the feature and fixes that will be included in release 0.15.0

body:
When i create a `datasets.DatasetDict` object with `datasets.Dataset`s from `rb.DatasetForTextClassification.to_datasets()`, loading them back fails with:


```python
from datasets import load_dataset, DatasetDict

ds_dict = DatasetDict(
    train=rb.DatasetForTextClassification(...).to_datasets(),
    test=rb.DatasetForTextClassification(...).to_datasets(),
)

ds_dict.push_to_hub("rubrix/test_datasetdict")

load_dataset("rubrix/test_datasetdict")

from rubrix.metrics.common import text_length

text_length(name="my-dataset") # --> This will fail
```

Metric summary should works

title: Utilize GPT3 embedding / classification API for more automated bulk labelling

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

body:
Keyword-based bulk labeling using Rubrix Rules is still too slow if I were to label thousands of texts for classification - at maximum, I can label 20 at a time since keyword match is noisy with regard to ground-truth label. 

I have played with GPT3 embeddings, where applying UMAP on texts results in clear clusters with semantically similar texts in clusters. If one can create Rubrix Rules instead based on a selected area on a scatterplot of text embeddings, then one can label hundreds of texts at once, and can easily finish labeling 50,000 data points in a day with high quality. And that'd be a game-changer.

Adding on to that, I also played with GPT3 classification API, where it gives pretty accurate few-shot classifications. And if that is added to the pipeline, it'd expedite labeling even further. Making it possible to label thousands of texts at once.

I have the GPT3 embedding + classification pipeline done in a notebook, is there plan on Rubrix's side to look into utilizing GPT3?

title: Prevent logging auto-setup

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

When importing anything from Rubrik, it automatically setups the Python logging, which surpress any configuration I might have done. This is currently done at line 70 of `__init__.py` with the command `configure_logging()`.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

I would like to be able to manually setup the logging *if needed*, instead of having it be done automatically on import. For example, calling `rubrix.configure_logging()` manually in my script.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**

I've tried configuring my logging after the import of Rubrix, but it still doesn't work. I've also tried importing the classes directly (like `Text2TextRecord`) without using the singleton from the `__init__,py`, but it still doesn't work.
